results.title: The Perfect English village
results.creator_credit: Nigel Farrell, VATV and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Producer/director/author and broadcaster Nigel Farrell leaves the chaos of the city in his Morris-Minor in search of the perfect, tranquil, village. Does it exist? Nigel is determined to find out. On his mission he locates beautiful villages in Sussex, Wiltshire, Devon, Essex and North Yorkshire, none of which seems to fit his impression of the perfect village. Nigel does eventually solve the puzzle of a tranquil idyll, but not where you expect it.

results.title: The Perception of life
results.brief_description: A history of the microscope. Deals with the evolution of ideas about the smallest units of life and the relation between what a scientist sees and the theories he creates. It begins with the work of the early microscopist and ends with our current theories of DNA and viruses. Narrated by Stephen Toulmin.

results.title: The Peoples of Africa
results.brief_description: Provides an economic, sociological and geographical study of the various peoples of Africa. Describes the influence that the Arabian and Negro elements along with the Bushmen, Pygmy and Indian contingents have had on African development. Also indicates the importance of European immigration. No other credits available.

results.title: The People of Parliament
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Barnes, Ian Host and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary explains the functions of Parliament by following the parliamentary day of two senators (Bob Collins and Kay Patterson) and two members of the House of Representatives (Kathy Sullivan and Stephen Martin). Parliamentarians are shown at work in their offices, at meetings of Parliamentary committees and at party political meetings as well as participating in debate in their respective houses.

results.title: The Penguins of Macquarie Island [B&W]
results.brief_description: Observes the habits of the various species of penguins which live on Macquarie Island. The film was compiled from record material photographed by members of the Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition and officers of the CSIRO. The penguins are seen marching to and from their rookeries, assembling on the beach, looking after their young, and at play. Various features, which distinguish one species from another, are illustrated.

results.title: The Peep show
results.creator_credit: Kaj Pindal, Colin Low, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A cartoon film for young children about the adventures of a little chick from the time he falls from an egg basket and breaks out of his shell. Together with a duck who happens along, he goes to explore the world and discovers there is much to learn, even about his own farmyard. Voice and narration by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: The Peacemaker
results.brief_description: A tribute to Dag Hammarskjoeld, late Secretary General of the United Nations. His leadership in a troubled period including the Korean War, the Suez crisis, and the conflict in the Congo are featured, as are his interests in the UN agencies for relief and development. He believed strongly in a personal contact between national leaders. This in part led to his death in an aircraft crash when visiting the troubled Congo in 1961.

results.title: The Peaceful revolution
results.creator_credit: Atma Ram, Michael Clarke and AEI Film Unit
results.brief_description: Addresses the growth of electrical power in India and the parallel development of education and technology with their effect on heavy and light industries, methods of agriculture and upon living conditions in the villages and cities. International contributions to this peaceful revolution are underlined, and outstanding technological achievements seen include hydroelectric projects, the Durgapur steel plant, and the electrical engineering services at Bhopal.

results.title: The Peace makers: 1919
results.creator_credit: Peter Baylis, Associated British-Pathe and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Highlights some of the events immediately following the end of World War I, such as the Versailles Peace Treaty Conference, the return of soldiers to America and Britain, the Great Victory Parade in London and the crossing of the Atlantic by Alcock and Brown. Narrated by Sir Ralph Richardson. Suitable for upper secondary level.
